verses.text: Wisdom protected the father of the world, who was created alone, and delivered him from his own fall by giving him dominion over all things.
verses.comment: Refers to Adam as 'the father of the world.' Wisdom is portrayed as actively saving and guiding humanity from the start, showing how God's wisdom is present even before the Law.

verses.text: Wisdom did not forsake the righteous man when he was sold, but rescued him from sin; she went down with him into a pit, and did not leave him in chains.
verses.comment: This refers to Joseph being sold into slavery. Wisdom is personified as staying with Joseph, a foreshadowing of divine providence and care in adversity.

verses.text: She raised him up from bondage and gave him the scepter of power over his oppressors, showing those who deserved to be deceived the lie, and glorified him forever.
verses.comment: Depicts Joseph's rise to authority in Egypt, showing how suffering is often used for greater good through a hidden plan.

verses.text: Wisdom delivered a holy people and a blameless seed from a nation that oppressed them.
verses.comment: Refers to the Exodus and liberation of Israel from Egypt. The language stresses the special status and purity of the chosen people.

verses.text: She entered the soul of a servant of the Lord and endured terrible kings with signs and wonders.
verses.comment: Refers to Moses. Wisdom empowers God's servant to confront oppressive rulers, indicating the role of God's Spirit guiding leaders into courageous acts.

verses.text: She rewarded the righteous and guarded them from their enemies, and protected them from deadly traps.
verses.comment: Highlights divine protection of the Israelites during the escape from Egypt.

verses.text: Wisdom gave them a rich journey, showed them the way, and covered them with a cloud by day and fire by night.
verses.comment: Refers to the pillar of cloud and fire leading Israel, a sign of God’s manifest guidance. The imagery prefigures later spiritual guidance given to believers.

verses.text: She crossed the Red Sea with them, led them through deep waters, and overwhelmed their enemies.
verses.comment: This verse strengthens the theme of salvation through divine intervention, connecting physical rescue with spiritual redemption.

verses.text: The righteous, therefore, plundered the ungodly; they sang your name, O Lord, and praised your victorious hand.
verses.comment: Recounts Israel’s song of praise after deliverance, emphasizing worship as a natural response to salvation.

verses.text: Wisdom opened the mouths of those who were mute and made the tongues of infants speak clearly.
verses.comment: This verse connects eloquence with divine inspiration, suggesting that speech and proclamation are gifts for God's purposes. Echoes spiritual gifts in the New Testament (see Acts 4:31).

verses.text: Wisdom prospered those who acted justly and guarded them from greed; she gave them riches that do not fade.
verses.comment: Highlights spiritual and moral prosperity, aligning with teachings on treasure in heaven.

verses.text: But those who were unjust, Wisdom exposed; she threw them down from their positions where they boasted.
verses.comment: Theme of reversal commonly seen in salvation history and Jesus’ teachings. Divine justice is shown through Wisdom as humbling the proud.

verses.text: Wisdom rescued the righteous from the traps of the wicked; she delivered him from fire and swords, and protected him from tyrants.
verses.comment: Hints at protection of the faithful under persecution, echoing Daniel and the fiery furnace, tying in with the theme of steadfast faith.

verses.text: She rewarded the righteous for their struggles, led them along a safe path, and revealed to them the kingdom of God.
verses.comment: Spiritual interpretation points to the revelation of God's kingdom as ultimate reward for faithfulness.

verses.text: Wisdom protected the righteous from their enemies, preserved them from slander, and gave them great glory forever.
verses.comment: Emphasizes the eternal honor granted to God's faithful people, echoing ideas of glorification and unity found in John's Gospel.

verses.text: She delivered the righteous from mighty kings and gave them authority over those who oppressed them.
verses.comment: Shows Wisdom's involvement in divine justice and political dominion, which hints at ordained leadership in salvation history.

verses.text: She showed the righteous the deceit of their enemies, and guided them on a straight path.
verses.comment: Divine wisdom is portrayed as practical moral guidance, echoing God’s promises of direction in Psalms and Proverbs.

verses.text: She gave the righteous insight into secret things and shielded them from harm.
verses.comment: Suggests wisdom's role in revelation and protection, which underlines the value of spiritual knowledge and discernment.

verses.text: Wisdom guided the righteous through deep waters and led them safely through disasters.
verses.comment: Ties Wisdom’s guidance to the Exodus and other trials, seeing all adversity as a potential journey to deeper communion with God.

verses.text: For the righteous struggled with their enemies, and were glorified by Wisdom, who gave them eternal triumph.
verses.comment: Here, Wisdom’s ultimate reward is eternal victory, suggesting an eschatological fulfillment pointing forward to resurrection and imperishable glory.

verses.text: The people praised Wisdom for her works and blessed her for protecting them.
verses.comment: Ends on thanksgiving, framing wisdom as the source for all deliverance, which encourages both literal gratitude and a spiritual devotion to God’s providence.
